page.title: 02FARMING IN NORTH-EAST LEICS.
page.content: The totally{rural}nature of this area of productive land means that the most important activity for the population is farming with almost all the{working {population}employed directly or indirectly by it. The farms vary in{size}from smallholdings of a few acres to much larger units up to 1200 acres.The farms are mainly family owned, being passed from one generation to the next,thus giving the area a{stable {population. The main farming type can be classified as{"mixed farming"}with all farms keeping livestock of some kind.There are several specialist dairy farms, a donkey stud farm and the rest of the farms grow a mixture of cash and fodder crops and rear animals for meat and wool.
